text: Hi guys, I was wondering if any of you already thought about 'hot reloading'? I was wondering if there is a way to reload the page when pushing new code. We use Browsersync for WordPress development and I would really like something similar for HubSpot dev.
And is there a way to develop locally by using something similar like the 'local-hubl-server'?

From my understanding "hot reloading" does work if you're previewing the template in HubSpot. I think you could technically preview locally with the local server, but I don't think there's a "step-by-step" tutorial for using it with the local dev beta atm. I kind of like the approach of just developing locally and leaving the compiling to HS in the cloud, but that's just my opinion.
Oh man, I hadn't even thought about using this with the local server

FYI, integrating with the local HubL server (adding a `server` sub-command) and integration with live reloading tools were both on our radar, but I can’t make any promises on when those features might be available.

In terms of workflow, testing my work in the editors as well as through reloading published or draft pages in a dev sandbox to be pretty useful. Both in terms of always having a feel for the content creation flow as well as testing changes across different scenarios while browsing a website.
I am also curious to hear what folks find most frustrating or annoying about the tools.
how would you fetch a file with a space in its name? npx hscms fetch --portal=DEV Video Title
I can fetch folders but how would I grab modules without underscores in the name?
You can wrap the argument in quotes `npx hscms fetch --portal=DEV "Video Title"`
It is also possible to escape the space with a backslash.  `npx hscms fetch --portal=DEV Video\ Title`

npx hscms fetch --portal=DEV "web_page_basic"
npx hscms fetch --portal=DEV "Video Title"
I was trying to grab both of these from the root directory one is a module and the other a folder
Modules need to have `.module` appended so “Video Title.module”
aha
Feature request - add option to copy file path to folders, files, and modules. If a module append .module so we can quickly paste in command line to fetch  or upload
cc <@U8ETJERFA>

i tried fetching a module named test and I put in the root - didn't work and then put it inside a folder it worked. So maybe it just doesn't work when have modules in the foot. a static file named test.css worked. Does this sound right?
sounds like we have a bug to fix

another thing I noticed when I fetched a module inside a folder on my local machine the folder structure is different from what is on the design manager. So it is hard to make a one to on comparison. Could you consider adding to the docs a preferred folder and file naming structure so we can follow what you output?

there is some info at <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-development-reference#local-module-format> but making module development smoother when it comes to documentation and the syntax is on our radar
